prompt: KINSHIP Hub Establishment & NARINTEL Documentation Transformation (Issues #21, #22, #23, PR #20)

primary.target: KINSHIP.md as the relational hub charter for the storytelling package

secondary.target: MISSION_251231.md into KINSHIP.md via git mv
KINSHIP.md content to follow Kinship Hub schema (Identity/Purpose, Lineage/Relations, Accountabilities, Responsibilities/Boundaries, Change Log)
NARINTEL_README.md with quality content reflecting kinship vision and Indigenous epistemological grounding
NARINTEL_OVERVIEW.txt content into NARINTEL_README.md, then remove the .txt
rispecs/COORDINATION_FROM_* files into KINSHIP.md lineage/relations section
/a/src/IAIP/rispecs as sibling kinship hub in KINSHIP.md
ava-lang* ecosystem (Python and TypeScript packages) as descendants/siblings in KINSHIP.md
NARINTEL_QUICK_START.md — either merge into README or keep as lightweight entry point

assumptions: MISSION_251231.md content is the seed material for KINSHIP.md — not a direct copy but a transformation
The NARINTEL_* files were generated by a less capable model and need substantive quality improvement
The Kinship Hub protocol in llms/llms-kinship-hub-system.md is the authoritative schema
NARINTEL codename refers to decolonized narrative intelligence — Indigenous E/O/M/A compatible
The user wants fewer but higher-quality documentation files
Coordination files in rispecs/ are inter-agent communication artifacts, not specifications

communications: Git commits with meaningful messages for each logical step

east.text: Envision KINSHIP.md as the living charter that maps storytelling's identity, lineage, accountabilities, and relational web within the ceremonial-technology ecosystem
Understand NARINTEL as structural reorientation toward Indigenous E/O/M/A — not decorative language

south.text: Analyze MISSION_251231.md to extract content that maps to Kinship Hub schema sections
Analyze COORDINATION_FROM_* files to extract lineage and relational data
Study llms/docs submodule to understand the portfolio of guidances and where storytelling sits

west.text: Validate KINSHIP.md against llms-kinship-hub-system.md schema — all required sections present
Validate NARINTEL_README.md captures consolidated overview without losing essential content
Ensure no working files are lost — commit before delete

north.text: Rewrite KINSHIP.md to Kinship Hub schema
Consolidate NARINTEL_OVERVIEW.txt into README then remove

actionStack.text: git mv MISSION_251231.md KINSHIP.md to preserve git history
Analyze MISSION_251231.md content for Kinship Hub schema mapping
Analyze COORDINATION_FROM_* and ecosystem paths for lineage/relations data
Rewrite KINSHIP.md following Kinship Hub minimal schema with ecosystem relations
Consolidate NARINTEL_OVERVIEW.txt valuable content into NARINTEL_README.md
Upgrade NARINTEL_README.md with quality content and kinship-aligned framing
Validate KINSHIP.md against schema and ecosystem coverage

ambiguities.text: Should NARINTEL_QUICK_START.md be kept as a separate file or merged into README?
ambiguities.suggestion: Keep it if it serves a distinct lightweight entry-point purpose; merge if it's redundant with the upgraded README

ambiguities.text: Exact scope of 'quality upgrade' for NARINTEL files — rewrite completely or improve incrementally?
ambiguities.suggestion: Substantive rewrite with kinship-aligned framing while preserving valuable domain content

ambiguities.text: Should KINSHIP.md preserve any of the original MISSION_251231.md code examples?
ambiguities.suggestion: Transform code examples into specification references; KINSHIP.md should be a relational charter, not an implementation plan
